CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 24, 1954, pg. 12 reads: "Easter Parade - The beautiful weather Sunday drew thousands of devout church-goers to their respective edifices to worship. And it also draw a glamorous parade of charming maids and matrons, bedecked in Easter finery.  Teenie Harris and Oceania Sockwell covered some fifteen churches to get the above photos...No. 3: Mary Ellen Walker, Mrs. Mamie Gery and Martha Watts were snapped parading on Centre Avenue."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Martha Watts wearing hat with netting, large fur, and corsage, standing on sidewalk, possibly Centre Avenue, Easter Sunday
